issue.title: feat: add `checkClosedHeadings` option in no-missing-atx-heading-space

repository.name: markdown
repository.description: Lint JavaScript code blocks in Markdown documents

issue.body:
<!--
    Thank you for contributing!

    ESLint adheres to the [OpenJS Foundation Code of Conduct](https://eslint.org/conduct).
-->

#### Prerequisites checklist

<!-- eslint-disable-next-line markdown/no-missing-label-refs -->
- [x] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md).

<!--
    Please ensure your pull request is ready:

    - Read the pull request guide (https://eslint.org/docs/latest/contribute/pull-requests)
    - Update or create tests
    - If performance-related, include a benchmark
    - Update documentation for this change (if appropriate)
-->

<!--
    The following is required for all pull requests:
-->

#### What is the purpose of this pull request?
 Add new option `checkClosedHeadings`.

#### What changes did you make? (Give an overview)

This PR supports the following options:

* `checkClosedHeadings: boolean` -
    When `true`, this option also checks for missing spaces before the closing `#` characters in ATX-style headings. (default: `false`)

    Examples of **incorrect** code when configured as `"no-missing-atx-heading-space": ["error", { checkClosedHeadings: true }]`:

    ```markdown
    <!-- eslint markdown/no-missing-atx-heading-space: ["error", { checkClosedHeadings: true }] -->
    
    # Heading 1#
    ## Heading 2##
    ### Heading 3###
    
    ```

#### Related Issues

Fix #409 

<!-- include tags like "fixes #123" or "refs #123" -->

#### Is there anything you'd like reviewers to focus on?
No
<!-- markdownlint-disable-file MD004 -->

body:
Sounds  really good to me ðŸ‘ 

Would like to hear some more opinions from @eslint/eslint-team

+1 on documenting expectations. But I'm not clear on what information could be provided that isn't already in https://eslint.org/docs/latest/contribute/work-on-issue#starting-work. The docs already note:

> If an issue has already been claimed by someone, please be respectful of that personâ€™s desire to complete the work and donâ€™t work on it unless you verify that they are no longer interested.

...which would have prevented the duplicate work in #450.

The only positive docs change I can think of would be to explicitly call out checking the _Participation_ checklist in issues.
I think there's a lot that can be clarified and the format can definitely be made easier to scan.

issue.title: docs: Update working on issues info

labels.name: accepted
labels.description: There is consensus among the team that this change meets the criteria for inclusion

repository.name: eslint
repository.description: Find and fix problems in your JavaScript code.

#### Prerequisites checklist

#### What is the purpose of this pull request? (put an "X" next to an item)

[ ] Add something to the core
[ ] Other, please explain:

    If the item you've checked above has a template, please paste the template questions below and answer them. (If this pull request is addressing an issue, you can just paste a link to the issue here instead.)
-->

<!--
    Please ensure your pull request is ready:

    - Read the pull request guide (https://eslint.org/docs/latest/contribute/pull-requests)
    - Include tests for this change
    - Update documentation for this change (if appropriate)
-->

<!--
    The following is required for all pull requests:
-->

#### What changes did you make? (Give an overview)

Clarified expectations around who is responsible for issues. This mostly just documents what we've already been doing in a clearer way.

fixes #19900
